text:
The Dealing Up Game: Writing and Evaluating Expressions

Dealing Up is a game that tests your creative skill at writing and calculating expressions.

Play the Dealing Up game. Keep track of the expressions that you and your classmates write.

Equipment:

  • Dealing Up Cards
  • Calculators (options)

Rules:

  • shuffle the Dealing Up cards
  • turn over four cards to the center of the table
  • players use the four numbers to write an expression with the greatest possible quantity
  • numbers can be used in any order and with any operation
  • players compare answers
  • each player explains why their answer is accurate and the greatest possible quantity
  • each player with an expression for the greatest quantity gets 1 point
  • the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
• What are some strategies you used to play the game? What properties of rational numbers listed in the Introduction did you use to evaluate your expression?
